overview_of_class: An introduction to the major forms of poetry in English from the dual perspective of the poet-critic. Creative work will be assigned in the form of poems and revisions; analytic writing will be assigned in the form of critiques of other members' poems. A scansion exercise will be given early on. All of these exercises, creative and expository, as well as the required readings from the Anthology, are designed to help students increase their understanding of poetry rapidly and profoundly; the more wholehearted students' participation, the more they will learn from the course.
name: Reading & Writing Poetry
title: WCAS ENGLISH 206-0-20 Reading & Writing Poetry
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Seniors may not register for this course.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: An introduction to the major forms of poetry in English from the dual perspective of the poet-critic. Creative work will be assigned in the form of poems and revisions; analytic writing will be assigned in the form of critiques of other members' poems. A scansion exercise will be given early on. All of these exercises, creative and expository, as well as the required readings from the Anthology, are designed to help students increase their understanding of poetry rapidly and profoundly; the more wholehearted students' participation, the more they will learn from the course.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Discussion; one-half to two-thirds of the classes will be devoted to discussion of readings and principles, the other classes to discussion of student poems.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Evidence given in written work and class participation of students' understanding of poetry; improvement will count for a great deal in estimating achievement.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: An anthology, a critical guide, 206 Reader prepared by the instructor, and the work of the other students.
